thread.title: Plainfield East football runs over Plainfield Central in season finale
thread.title_full: Plainfield East football runs over Plainfield Central in season finale

title: Plainfield East football runs over Plainfield Central in season finale
text:
Plainfield East football runs over Plainfield Central in season finale   12:32 a.m. CDT By KEVIN RYAN - Shaw Media Correspondent 
PLAINFIELD – Going into Week 9 out of the playoff hunt, one of the only things left on the line is pride. Despite the constant rain and muddy field conditions Friday night, Plainfield East showed how much pride it still had by beating cross-town District 202 rival Plainfield Central, 52-19. Related Links Lockport football spoils Joliet West's playoff hopes 
“We played hard and our kids practiced hard all week,” East coach Mike Romeli said. “We didn’t know what we were getting into, but our seniors continued to lead and they did a great job tonight.” 
One of the seniors who stole the spotlight was running back Jeremy Reitz, who had 13 carries for 156 yards and touchdown runs of 7 and 17 yards. Senior quarterback Matthew Mazurkiewicz (6-of-14 for 109 yards) also contributed with two touchdown passes from 9 and 3 yards. 
The Wildcats did get on the board in the second quarter when Lovelle Houston (10 carries for 30 yards) got past the goal line on a 5-yard run. Central also was able to put up two late touchdowns, but they were not nearly enough. 
“The seniors played well and they didn’t quit on me," Central coach John Jackson said. "I’m proud of the seniors and I hope they have a good career in whatever they’re going to do.”
